channel.title: Introduction :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: A critical part of the software development process is ensuring the software works! We mentioned earlier that it is possible to logically prove that software works by constructing a state transition table for the program, but once a program reaches a certain size this strategy becomes less feasible. Similarly, it is possible to model a program mathematically and construct a theorem that proves it will perform as intended. But in practice, most software is validated through some form of testing.
